title: [K-12] Animation-Based Exploration of States of Matter and Solubility

context.prior_knowledge: Familiarity with foundational chemistry terminology (molecules, thermal energy, etc.) and experience in observing simple experiments
context.additional_context: Activity-based instruction using digital devices, operating a feedback system that reflects formative assessment results in real time

learning_goals: After observing animations of macroscopic phenomena in the three states of matter (solid/liquid/gas) and phase changes, learners can explain them with 80% accuracy
Learners can analyze solubility processes at the molecular level through animations and explain the concept of saturated solutions by connecting them to experimental data
Learners can describe the effects of thermal energy changes on molecular motion in written form, linked to visual materials
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
